results.title: The New Museum Is World Class, but Many Find It a Tough Place to Work
results.abstract: Critics acknowledge the success the New Museum in New York has achieved. But they say it has come at the expense of many people who work there.

multimedia.caption: The New Museum in Lower Manhattan receives high marks for its exhibitions, but many workers have complained about how it is managed.

results.title: Mellon Foundation to Spend $250 Million to Reimagine Monuments
results.abstract: The initiative, the largest in the organization’s history, will support the creation of new monuments, as well as the relocation or rethinking of existing ones.

multimedia.caption: In July, in Richmond Va., a photograph of Breonna Taylor was projected onto a statue of the Confederate general Robert E. Lee.

results.title: ‘The Social Network’ 10 Years Later: A Grim Online Life Foretold
results.abstract: At the time, the fictional story of Facebook’s founding seemed overdramatic; now it underscores how our connections have changed, especially in the Covid era.

results.title: Blood, Passion and Captivity: Gentileschi’s Life Is in Her Paintings
results.abstract: A new blockbuster exhibition at the National Gallery in London shows the artist’s defiant strength, forged in the trials she endured.

multimedia.caption: Gentileschi’s “Judith Beheading Holofernes,” from about 1613, is an example of the fashion at the time for depictions of strong biblical women.
multimedia.copyright: Museo e Real Bosco di Capodimonte, Napoli

results.title: Making the Monsters of ‘Lovecraft Country’
results.abstract: Grant Walker, who helped create the HBO show’s nightmarish Shoggoth creatures, had “a lot of fun designing the teeth and the mouth and all of the blood.”

results.title: ‘Stairway to Heaven’ Copyright Case Won’t Go to Supreme Court
results.abstract: The court’s decision leaves in place an appeals court ruling that Led Zeppelin did not copy part of a 1968 song, ending the long-running dispute.

multimedia.caption: Robert Plant, left, with Jimmy Page at a Led Zeppelin reunion concert in 1988. The Supreme Court declined to hear a case involving “Taurus,” a 1968 song by the psychedelic band Spirit.

results.title: Thomas Jefferson Byrd, Actor in Spike Lee Films, Dies at 70

results.title: With No New Films, Regal Cinemas Shuts Down Again

results.abstract: With “The Searcher,” French moves away from the Dublin Murder Squad and her usual Dublin setting to drink in the open landscapes of western Ireland.

results.title: With ‘The Searcher,’ Tana French Ventures Into New Territory
